intro: Macrolobium archeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by birds and insects. Macrolobium archeri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
